title: SCP-8747
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:basalt darkmode=a | hidetitle=a | wide=a]]

[[=]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/=]]


@@ @@
[[div class="blockquote"]]
[[div class="tofrom"]]

**To:** roseanne@site19.scip.int
**From:** [VERIFIED OVERSEER ACCOUNT]
**Subject:** Assignment.
[[/div]]
----

Good evening, Director.

I have been paying attention to you and your department's efforts of trying to contain GoI-6183. I understand it's not that simple, and despite that, you still continue to adhere to the Foundation's principles.

Which is why I am assigning you to a project that might help you with that. Everything you need to know is in this file.

__sub-project#15839__

You have until tomorrow to respond. Don't keep me waiting.

[[>]]

O5-8,
[[span style="color: gray; font-size: 70%;"]]Overseer of Foundation Projects and Development.[[/span]]
[[/>]]
[[/div]]

[[include :scp-wiki:component:anomaly-class-bar-source
|item-number= SCP-8747
|clearance= 1
|container-class= keter
|secondary-class= none

|disruption-class= ekhi
|risk-class= caution
]]

[[div class="modal"]]
[[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|SPECIAL CONTAINMNET PROCEDURES:##[[/span]] [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]] is uncontained. Personnel of the now defunct **PROJECT CYBERSPHERE** are tasked with research and execution of any method for potential rectification/neutralization/containment of [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]] at Site-19. This specific set of personnel has been granted an unlimited budget and resources by the O5 Council to achieve this goal.

Until its correction, staff are discouraged from utilizing the primary Foundation database as a means of record-keeping or communication, and instead refer to physical writing, though this directive is excused for long-range communication or other specific requirements. IT and AIAD staff are not to ameliorate any bugs or exploits deriving from the Foundation database, or AI/OCU[[footnote]]Organic Consciousness Interface, a specific set of AI systems originating from human consciousness following the conclusion of [[span class="bt"]]##b60707|PROJECT SARGASSO##.[[/span]] [[/footnote]] systems.

Containment Specialists responsible for the circumscription of digital anomalies are to review their containment protocols and determine if re-evaluation is necessary. The most common directives are:

* Disinformation campaigns discouraging civilian access to anomalous websites/data.
* Blocking IP Addresses of anomalous websites.
* Manipulating algorithm within the civilian database to reduce chances of civilian encounter with a digital anomaly[[footnote]] Example of which is when the algorithm for [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-4319 SCP-4319] was manipulated to display feline wildlife. [[/footnote]].

Information relating to [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]] from the general public is semi-contained via global disinformation campaigns, with assistance from governments and Foundation agents embedded within news outlets, misplacing [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]] to be a "catastrophic digital failure". Agents are also required to discourage, or discredit civilian efforts of discerning [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]].


[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-4224 Global amnestic administration] is currently on stand-by in preparation for an LV-Class "Broken Masquerade" Scenario. Should this occur, no further containment procedures are necessary.
[[/div]]
@@ @@
@@ @@

[[div class="darkdocument"]]
= [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|ADDENDUM 8747/1:##[[/span]] Contextual Information.
------

[[div class="notation dd"]]
= **//Recruitment Letter//**
------
Humans have evolved since the dawn of humanity. The range and scope of our cognitive function and capabilities spans across the multiverse. From what was once a little spec, now to the warden who seals the anomalous, we are the dominant species who reign supreme across the globe thanks to the advancement of our species.

One of these advancements were the creation of technology; an irreplaceable aspect that runs within the heart and lungs of the Foundation. Prior to its creation, any rumor someone made about a video game or incident would be called an "Urban Legend" because nobody would be able to verify if the rumor was true, or not. Today, finding out the answer would be a simple Google search on your phone. Of course, this advancement has birthed more progressive and complex anomalies. Such anomalies can be [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-2000 invaluable] to our goals, others would be [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-245 laughable], or even change how [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-3959 the world could function]. 

Regardless of their nature, the core directive of our Foundation hasn't altered; the question is, what's the best way to respond to these anomalies? Contain, study, supress information, and above all, protect humanity from their existence. While these containment procedures yielded successful results, they do not, however, develop the complete cessation of further and current digital anomalies, as the Foundation possess no feasible method for that field of action.

This is where you come in; whoever you are, you know you've been an invaluable member the research and advancement of Foundation technology. Our objective is to manipulate digital anomalies on a conceptual level, and you are here to help with that goal. We are not just looking for people who have an answer to the unknown and work with what they do not understand. We're looking for those to who can shape the capabilities of what the Foundation can do, and inspire others to achieve the same.

Welcome to Project Cybersphere.

//Roseanne Thatcher,//
//Director of Containment,//
//Site-19.//
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
@@ @@
@@ @@
[[div class="modal"]]
[[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|DESCRIPTION:##[[/span]] [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]] refers to the anomalously enforced inability for all anomalous objects, and digital data to be deleted from technological systems. All efforts to expunge or overwrite reference data remains ineffective. Despite its characteristics, the anomaly appears to have no effect against written material, other non-digital media, and its existence has theorized to have been manufactured by the creation of [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747-A##[[/span]].

[[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747-A##[[/span]] is a 3km diameter of corrupted space located within the Cybersphere, a medium wherein all digitally stored data reside in. [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747-A##[[/span]] can be described as a space wherein digital data within the Cybersphere has been rendered unusable, which has impacted our reality computer notions' functions, though the full range and scale of [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747-A##[[/span]]'s disruption has yet to be concluded. It is currently stationary, displaying no signs of expansion or movement. 

[[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747-A##[[/span]] is the result of a failed Foundation-attempt to conceptually alter the mechanics and existence of digital anomalies, termed **PROJECT CYBERSPHERE**. The project was primarily aimed to assist containment and nullify the effects of digital anomalies[[footnote]] With the exception of ones classified as [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|THAUMIEL##[[/span]].[[/footnote]], regardless of their properties and origins via Foundation alterations within the Cybersphere utilizing an eigenmachine, ordered by O5-8.

[[=]]
[[collapsible show="+OPEN PROJECT FILE+" hide="-CLOSE PROJECT FILE-"]]
[[div class="darkdocument"]]

[[=]]
+ [[span class="bt"]]PROJECT CYBERSPHERE[[/span]] 
++++ SUB-PROJECT #15839
[[/=]]

[[div style="text-align: right; font-size: 90%; font-style: italic"]]
02/17/2035,
O5-8,
Overseer Council.
[[/div]]
[[<]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]
**OBJECTIVE:** Construct a Foundation-made eigenmachine, designated AO-8747, capable of altering the nature of digital anomalies, and potentially enact containment to GoI-6183 ("[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/deleted SCP Foundation Department of Deletions]").

**ELUCIDATION:** Data regarding the ever-increasing number detailing computerized abnormalities, followed by higher demand of containment efforts, has led to analysis concerning means of amelioration. Additionally, GoI-6183 refers to a hostile group of interest comprising of extradimensional entities. This Group of Interest is believed has been responsible for the destruction of a Foundation timeline[[footnote]] Designated TL-6768. [[/footnote]], in accordance with documentation gathered from multiversal Foundation sites. This threat has been designated an [[span class="bt"]]##ff0000|APOLLYON##[[/span]]-Class priority.

----
**PROCEDURE:** Development of **PROJECT CYBERSPHERE** will take place at the 10th basement level of Foundation Containment and Research facility, Site-19, to obtain a medium of security and secrecy from hostile Groups of Interest, as well as a feasible method of retrieving resources. Four Scranton Reality Anchors have been installed to protect construction from a potential CK-Class scenario. Once pre-development for **PROJECT CYBERSPHERE** has been concluded, the following machinery must be implemented for **PROJECT CYBERSPHERE**'s continuation:

[[div class="accessibility-invert"]]
[[include component:image-block
name=image-28.png
|caption=Schematic drawing for AO-8747.
|width=320px
|align=right]]
[[/div]]

**SECTION A:** Central Computing Node

AO-8747 will be manually operated by human cognitive and locomotive function. This engineering decision will enable personnel to access greater control and precision based on personal skepticism and professionalism. This also avoids non-human, automotive errors staff encountered from AI systems, and allow personnel to adjust to conditions that an Artificial Intelligence Conscript may fail to adapt.

**SECTION B:** P. H. Ontokinetic Sink

The Placeholder Ontokinetic Sink will be added to read the sum of our reality's quantum informational content and converting said info into a comprehensive configuration, enabling AO-8747 and other connect systems to process and react data from our universe, whilst also allowing AO-8747 to access the Cybersphere.

**SECTION C:** Dual Cylindrical-subconscious Transfer.

Two handpick subjects with surgically implanted Cognitive Adapters[[footnote]] //Cognitive Adapters//, a newly designed, technological chip intended to allow Foundation personnel to view the perspective of implanted subjects upon its corresponding frequency receiver, including outside of realities and various esoteric mediums. [[/footnote]] will enter one of two of these devices. One inside and activated, their subconscious mind will be transferred to whatever esoteric medium AO-8747 has been selected; as of writing, AO-8747 is designed to specifically access the Cybersphere only.

**SECTION D:** Resh-Norma Digital-rot Applicator.

Once the supposed extradimensional entities have been located, the RNDA will be manually operated by Foundation personnel to apply a conceptually application of accelerated digital rot towards the desired target. This process will result in selected data to be unusable, though this applied digital rot may result in Foundation or civilian computerized systems to become inoperable.

**SECTION E:** Display Panel

To enable staff cognitive footage of handpicked subjects and accurately determine the verdict of events.

**SECTION F:** Control Panel.
**SECTION G:** Data-storage center.
**SECTION H:** Industrial Power Generators.

[[/div]]
[[/<]]
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]
[[/=]]

The project took place at Site-19's 10th Basement level, a medium intended for **PROJECT CYBERSPHERE** to be developed, over the course of 10-years with simplistic access to resources whilst maintaining acceptable security and veiled from Groups of Interest. Once development was complete on 04/05/2045, the following events occurred:

||~ Local Time ||~ Occurrence ||
|| [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|14:32:36##[[/span]] || Dir. Rosanne Thatcher ordered AO-8747 to be activated.||
|| [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|14:32:54##[[/span]] || AO-8747 activates. ||
|| [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|14:33:03##[[/span]] || Personnel began enacting preparations and configuration for the first human exploration into the Cybersphere. ||
|| [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|14:34:10##[[/span]] || Dir. Rosanne Thatcher ordered two selected, Foundation personnel to enter the Dual Cylindrical-subconscious Transfer devices. ||
|| [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|14:35:27##[[/span]] || The subjects enter as instructed. ||
|| [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|14:36:13##[[/span]] || **PROJECT CYBERSPHERE** staff commence additional activations and configuration to enable transfer to the Cybersphere. ||
|| [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|14:37:42##[[/span]] || Subconscious-transfer process goes into effect. ||
|| [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|14:37:49##[[/span]] || Lead Engineer, Jessica Abraham, report an error regarding full registration of subconcious-transfer ||
|| [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|14:37:58##[[/span]] || **PROJECT CYBERSPHERE** staff try to ameliorate the situation by restarting AO-8747 and checking for any errors. No sufficient results were found. ||
|| [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|14:41:02##[[/span]] || Dir. Roseanne then ordered the subconscious-transfer process to be cancelled, and AO-8747 shut down for maintenance. ||
|| [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|14:42:13##[[/span]] || Subconscious-transfer process cancellation successful, however, AO-8747 was still anchoring and processing data from the Cybersphere despite efforts. ||
|| [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|14:43:32##[[/span]] || Dir. Roseanne order immediate cessation of shutdown-protocols. Actions upon order were unsuccessful. Shut down protocols now inevitable. ||
|| [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|14:43:56##[[/span]] || AO-8747 fully shutdown, however an explosion was found, originating from AO-8747's PH OS. Ontokinetic Sink appears to be in great structural damage. ||
|| [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|14:46:29##[[/span]] || RAISA receives reports about computer systems failing to overwrite data. Investigation is soon followed. ||

[[/div]]
@@ @@
@@ @@
[[div class="jotting modal tableb"]]

[[table]]
[[row]]
[[hcell]]
O4 SUMMIT LOG/8747/01
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell]]
**DATE:** 18/05/2045

**FOREWORD:** This security footage, and all remaining transcripts, have been truncated for brevity. The following depicts recording of the O4 Summit voting to conclude regarding Dir. Roseanne's position of **PROJECT CYBERSPHERE**.

**PERSONNEL INVOLVED:**

* Dir. Roseanne Thatcher, Director of Containment.
* Dir. Calvin Bold, Director of Decommissioning.
* Dir. Arezu Ebrahimi, Director of Misinformation.
* 90~ other A-Class personnel relating to O4 Council.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[hcell]]
« BEGIN TRANSCRIPT »
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[hcell]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
[[<]]
= //[...]//

[[span class="bt"]]##FF2400|**Dir. Arezu:**##[[/span]] Why are we this having this Summit again? I've already filed a report to the Overseers, yet I've received no response. I only think of this as a distraction from my own work.

[[span class="bt"]]##4169e1|**Dir. Calvin Bold:**##[[/span]] This Summit was an order by the Overseers, as they currently have their hands full right now; to recap, this was called upon to determine whether Dir. Roseanne should be disbarred from her position due to her unprofessional actions, or not.

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] A direction that I heavily disagree on; I am, or at least was, responsible for leading **PROJECT CYBERSPHERE**. I know more about the ins and outs of AO-8747 more than anyone in this room. So, if you give me your unconditionally support-

[[span class="bt"]]##FF2400|**Dir. Arezu:**##[[/span]] Support? You think you are the only here that needs "support", and no anyone else?

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] That's not what I was trying to imply-

[[span class="bt"]]##FF2400|**Dir. Arezu:**##[[/span]] Look at how much shit the Foundation has to clean-up because of //your// mess; over 500 hundred containment breaches of anomalies needing to be deleted, tech staff can't code because if they make a mistake, they won't be able to undo it, people are questioning what's going on, we're burning thousands of Foundation resources, do I need to remind you that some "account" is leaking info about the formation of an anomalous terrorist group in Spain?

[[span class="bt"]]##4169e1|**Dir. Calvin Bold:**##[[/span]] Before we proceed, I may recommend that Dir. Arezu try to relax before continuing. 

//<[[span class="bt"]]##4169e1|**Dir. Calvin Bold:**##[[/span]] looks toward Dir. Arezu.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##4169e1|**Dir. Calvin Bold:**##[[/span]] Agree?

//<[[span class="bt"]]##FF2400|**Dir. Arezu:**##[[/span]] presses his temples.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##FF2400|**Dir. Arezu:**##[[/span]] Agree.

//<[[span class="bt"]]##4169e1|**Dir. Calvin Bold:**##[[/span]] then looks toward [[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]]>//

[[span class="bt"]]##4169e1|**Dir. Calvin Bold:**##[[/span]] Now, I share the same thoughts that several of our members possess; what made you, and O5-8 believe this Group of Interest was, specifically, at the Cybersphere in the first place?

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] I can't speak for the intentions of O5-8, but what several Cybersphere staff and I believe, is that this group is comprised of "deleted data"- what I mean by that is it's possible this Group of Interest came from an extra-dimensional timeline, or timelines that were "overwritten" in some manner; wherever that "deleted data" went to, it's like the Cybersphere.

[[span class="bt"]]##4169e1|**Dir. Calvin Bold:**##[[/span]] So, you're not 100% sure whether this "Department of Deletions" is actually in the Cybersphere or not?

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] ... No.

[[span class="bt"]]##FF2400|**Dir. Arezu:**##[[/span]] So why invest lots of Foundation resources to deal with a threat that you're not even sure of?

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] It was a direct Overseer order. I had no say on the project's direction, other than leading **PROJECT CYBERSPHERE** staff to its completion. Besides, it was an Apollyon-Class priority; does that speak for itself?

[[span class="bt"]]##FF2400|**Dir. Arezu:**##[[/span]] It doesn't, however, mean we should disregard confirming whether the anomaly's there, or not.

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] We? Who is this "we"? There was only me, staff, and Overseer. I don't recall you being involved.

[[span class="bt"]]##FF2400|**Dir. Arezu:**##[[/span]] Fair argument.

[[span class="bt"]]##4169e1|**Dir. Calvin Bold:**##[[/span]] What this all means is, you were either correct in believing that this extradimensional group of entities were in the Cybersphere or got it wrong and wasted Foundation resources on nothing.

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] That's... That might be it.

[[span class="bt"]]##4169e1|**Dir. Calvin Bold:**##[[/span]] Regardless of whether this group was truly in the Cybersphere or not, the fact of the matter is that your actions were incredibly irresponsible and led to the creation of an anomaly impacting both civilian and Foundation technology. So, I want to ask you this; why should anyone trust you in continuing to the project if you are going to create results this disastrous?

//<There is silence in the transcript.>>//

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] I... I had no illicit intent. As stated earlier, I know the ins and outs of the project, more than anyone else, even some of the staff. I want to try, and work on fixing things.

[[span class="bt"]]##FF2400|**Dir. Arezu:**##[[/span]] Like how you worked on the PH OS?

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] What do you mean?

//<[[span class="bt"]]##FF2400|**Dir. Arezu:**##[[/span]] pulls out a series of documents from his lab coat, and places them onto his table.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##FF2400|**Dir. Arezu:**##[[/span]] This is the latest report from maintenance staff working on AO-8747.

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] Where did you-

[[span class="bt"]]##FF2400|**Dir. Arezu:**##[[/span]] Just listen. In this report, they've conducted an inspected on the PH. OS, as it was the only part of AO-8747's schematics that didn't function properly; they've found out it was faulty, as during AO-8747's deactivation, the PH OS didn't because it was still trying to anchor itself and process data from the Cybersphere, whilst not registering the deactivation due to its faultiness. Therefore, this is another case of Foundation staff incompetence.

//<The room erupts with members berating over the discovery. [[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] flinches.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] How, how come I wasn't briefed by this?

[[span class="bt"]]##FF2400|**Dir. Arezu:**##[[/span]] I was having with a discussion with your staff about the matter and when I found out about what caused this disaster, the O4 Summit was scheduled to start in 40 minutes. I convinced them to hold-on to it, until the summit started.

//<[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] stands-up from her chair.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] But, but I can still fix this-

[[span class="bt"]]##4169e1|**Dir. Calvin Bold:**##[[/span]] I believe you've "fixed" enough.

= //[...]//
[[/<]]
[[/div]]

[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[hcell]]
« END TRANSCRIPT »
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell]]
**AFTERWORD:** Final vote concluded as 80-15-5 for Dir. Roseanne to be removed from **PROJECT CYBERSPHERE** and further directives regarding the [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]] crisis. O5 Council now leads containment/decommission efforts soon on.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[hcell]]
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]
[[/table]]

[[/div]]
@@ @@
@@ @@

[[div class="notation"]]
= [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|ADDENDUM 8747/2:##[[/span]] Containment/Decommision Attempts.

**FOREWORD:** Due to the aftereffects of O5-8's actions, containment projects relating to [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8474##[[/span]] must be approved by the O5 Council. All personnel, regardless of clearance and position, are welcome to provide their own proposals. Please note, many proposals have been omitted for brevity.
------
[[div class="blockquote"]]
**PROPOSAL:** Intentionally sever association with [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]] within the Cybersphere via ontokinetic anomaly. ([https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-239 SCP-239])

**COUNCIL VOTE SUMMARY:** [[span class="bt"]]##ffc60b|APPROVED##[[/span]] (6-4-2)

**RESULTS:** Upon Overseer order, SCP-239 was allowed to be awoken from her medically induced coma. SCP-239 was then clarified about a "giant monster" affecting central computers, and was provided a brief description, casual description of [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]] and -A. She was then instructed both anomalies to be erased from existence and non-Foundation lifeforms to lose recall of said anomalies. 

SCP-239 commanded the anomaly to be removed from existence, only for Foundation staff to report no noticeable changes from computerized systems[[footnote]] It is uncertain whether SCP-239's effects have no impact on the Cybersphere, or her anomalous properties were directly misplaced due to lack of understanding of SCP-239's perspective regarding the anomaly. [[/footnote]]. Civilian populations and Groups of Interest worldwide lacked recall regarding [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]], only for the anomaly to be reported shortly after. This, however, has temporarily lessened Foundation resources in concealing the veil.

SCP-239 was re-contained shortly after.
------
**PROPOSAL:** Engineer a machine capable of severing connections between our reality and the Cybersphere, thus invalidating [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]]'s effects.

**COUNCIL VOTE SUMMARY:** [[span class="bt"]]##ff0000|DENIED##[[/span]] (4-8-0)

**RESULTS:** N/A

//Even if this machine worked as intended, it would render all digital systems useless worldwide as we are too dependent on the Cybersphere's existence, hindering Foundation operations significantly. AIAD, IT, and relevant staff required for developing and maintaining Foundation technology would be rendered obsolete. Finally, civilian populations are highly likely to believe anomalous phenomenon should all digital systems become dysfunctional. - O5-3//
------
= [30 PROPOSALS OMITTED]
------
**PROPOSAL:** Establish contact or influence a [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/sandrewswann-s-proposal/ hypernarrative entity] to contain/decommission [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]].

**COUNCIL VOTE SUMMARY:** [[span class="bt"]]##ffc60b|APPROVED##[[/span]] (10-2-0)

**RESULTS:** Five minutes following deployment of a specialized memetic agent into a medium containing high-energy narrative structures, O5-1 received a verified email from a SWN-001 entity, reading, "Do you guys ever learn from your mistakes?"

No further communication was received.
------
**PROPOSAL:** Create an ontokinetic eigenweapon, capable of encapsulating [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747-A##[[/span]] in a dome-like medium, suppressing it's effects and potentially eradicating [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]].

**COUNCIL VOTE SUMMARY:** [[span class="bt"]]##ffc60b|APPROVED##[[/span]] (8-2-2)

**RESULTS:** The proposed eigenweapon was created and **PROJECT CYBERPSHERE** staff confirmed it's intended, functional use of encapsulating [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747-A##[[/span]]; however, it was later discovered the capsule had no effect of suppressing it's effect. 20 minutes following usage, the capsule housing [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747-A##[[/span]] began to "corrupt" and 1 minute later, [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747-A##[[/span]]'s size has increased by approximately 5km in diameter. Reports of more digital systems rendered inoperable were followed.

Future similar proposals will not be accepted.
------
= [130 PROPOSALS OMITTED]
------
**PROPOSAL:** One D-Class is to be surgically implanted with a Cognitive Adapter within their cerebellum. He is then to be provided false information of [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747-A##[[/span]] and directed into AO-8747's subconscious transfer device. From there, he is instructed to traverse to [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747-A##[[/span]] and vocalize infohazardous data of [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-2521 ●●|●●●●●|●●|●], theoretically inducing a hostile attack onto it's position.

**COUNCIL VOTE SUMMARY:** [[span class="bt"]]##ff0000|DENIED##[[/span]] (2-9-1)

**RESULTS:** N/A

//While a creative theory, it is likely that ●●|●●●●●|●●|● will not attack [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747-A##[[/span]] itself, and instead attack the D-Class. Furthermore, there is even the possibility that ●●|●●●●●|●●|● will be virulent towards AO-8747's structure, which cannot be allowed as it is one of the few methods the Foundation possess of accessing the Cybersphere. - O5-7//
------
[[/div]]
[[/div]]


@@ @@
@@ @@
[[div class="jotting modal tableb"]]

[[table]]
[[row]]
[[hcell]]
CCTV FOOTAGE/8747/02
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell]]
**DATE:** 21/05/2045

**FOREWORD:** The following transcript displays recording of two Foundation personnel, on account of the O4 Summit's conclusion.

**PERSONNEL INVOLVED:**

* Dir. Roseanne Thatcher, Director of Containment.
* Dr. Parker Jackson, Secretary for Department of Containment.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[hcell]]
« BEGIN TRANSCRIPT »
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[hcell]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
[[<]]
//<[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne**##[[/span]] is seen in her office, going through paperwork. She appears dissatisfied. A door knocks in-front of her.//

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] Come in.

//<The door opens.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] Morning, Parker.

[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] Morning, Rose. You slept well?

//<[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne**##[[/span]] shakes her head left and right.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] Still upset?

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] Yep.

[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] Okay, look, the O4 voted to kick you out of the project, but so what? You've still got a job here.

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] But not so much for support.

[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] You've got my support, Rose. Is there anything I can do that'll make you feel better?

//<Silence.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] Well, I've looked at the full file for the 8747 containment attempts; surprisingly, none of them work. I've already sent my own proposal, but I haven't heard from the Council since.

[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] I, I'm sorry about that.

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] Don't be, it's not your fault.

[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] But I was involved, wasn't I?

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] Yeah, but because of me and the O5's; speaking of which, I haven't heard from that bastard Eight for a while.

[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] What about him?

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] I'll get to that later, but for now, you said you want to help me, right?

[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] Yeah. Do you want me to get you a snack, coffee, or...

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] How about this; you take this proposal I have and send it to the **PROJECT CYBERSPHERE** staff about it, okay? Maybe they'll respond to you sooner, since people here care more about you.

[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] You know they don't accept duplicate proposals, right?

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] So, how about I just, rephrase it and it'll work.

[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] Why are you even doing this, Rose? I find that unprofessional from a Department Head.

//<[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne**##[[/span]] leans forward, her arms now rest on her desk.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] Listen, Parker. My face and name are spread all over Foundation news, even outside of our universe, as the biggest bitch the Foundation's ever hired. And during this, I've called Eight //many times// about how I could get out of this, and he's ignored me since the project went to shit. You know what that means? 

//<<Silence again.>>//

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] It means he just left me on the dust and out there doing God knows what, and I even could wind-up losing my job here; someone could easily say, "Overseers, this bitch who was the cause of your system's fuckups is not fit for the role Containment Director", and they'll be like, "Alright, let's fire this whore".

[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] Don't say that about yourself.

//[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] wipes a tear from her eye.//

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] I'm sorry, I just... I hate. Hate it so much. This project idea was such a horrible idea, I never should've accepted the offer.

[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] Hey, hey. It's okay. I don't blame you. You were just following orders and we know what happens when you don't listen to an Overseer.

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] Fuck the Overseers.

//<[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] lets out a chuckle.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] Fuck the Overseers.

[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] Oh, and don't worry too much about losing your job because of this, too; we've seen [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6747 worse after all], yet they still work here, so I don't see why you would not. And if they do try fire you for this, we could say, "Overseers, if you think she should be fired, why does this man with a ridiculous name still work here, despite the trouble he almost caused?"

//<[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne**##[[/span]] bursts into laughter.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] Oh yeah, good luck arguing that. 

//<[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne**##[[/span]] lets out a smile.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] Seriously though, thanks for coming to see me. I needed a laugh, really.

//[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] smiles back.//

[[span class="bt"]]##4dff4d|**Dr. Parker:**##[[/span]] You're welcome. I'll try and re-send your proposal once it's reworded. 

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] Thank yo-

//<[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne**##[[/span]]'s office phone rings>//

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] Excuse me for a second.

//<She picks it up, and presses it against her ear.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] Hello? Yeah, I'm the one who sent it.

//<[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne**##[[/span]]'s eyes widens>//

[[span class="bt"]]##ff00d4|**Dir. Roseanne:**##[[/span]] Really?!

= //[...]//
[[/<]]
[[/div]]
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[hcell]]
« END TRANSCRIPT »
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]

[[div class="jotting modal tableb"]]

[[table]]
[[row]]
[[hcell]]
CCTV FOOTAGE/8747/03
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell]]
**DATE:** 20/05/2045

**FOREWORD:** As the Overseer Council and Ethics Committee determine a desirable decision in light of the [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]] event, two A-Class personnel discuss personal matters.

**PERSONNEL INVOLVED:**

* O5-8, Overseer of Foundation Projects and Development.
* Omar Amadi, liaison for the O5 Council and Ethics Committee.
* Four Security Officers, armed with automatic rifles.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[hcell]]
« BEGIN TRANSCRIPT »
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[hcell]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
[[<]]
= //[...]//

//<Footage depicts O5-8 sitting in-front of his desk, with the two-armed officers standing behind him. Omar is sitting on the opposite end of O5-8, as the two guards mirror the ones upfront.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8:**##[[/span]] Hold on, hold on, hold on. Stop for a moment, I didn't understand. You want me to what?

[[span class="bt"]]##b49f60|**Omar Amandi:**##[[/span]] Plead guilty to what happened on the project. That way, we could negotiate a reduced sentence between us and the Ethics.

//<For a moment, [[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8**##[[/span]] tilts his head slightly to the ground in annoyance as he slowly raises his right palm in the air. He then raises his head to face Omar, his arm descending down.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8:**##[[/span]] Listen, I didn't bring you here to tell me to incriminate myself about **PROJECT CYBERSPHERE** and let the Ethics take a shit on me. I told you to help me get out of this, because I got 12 other people wanting me gone for good, and nobody else wants to help me, but you. So please, give me that. 

//<[[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8**##[[/span]] leans back on his chair>.//

[[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8:**##[[/span]] Review the case properly, figure out whatever decision that nobody else could come up, testify for me, do something.

[[span class="bt"]]##b49f60|**Omar Amandi:**##[[/span]] Testify to what? I wasn't even involved.

[[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8:**##[[/span]] Well, you could say that someone or something, like some outside anomaly sabotaged the entire thing, and maybe with that, I'll get less of the blame.

[[span class="bt"]]##b49f60|**Omar Amandi:**##[[/span]] That's deceptive, Overseer, and we both know that won't work- but, I'll try to "review the case properly", as you've instructed.

//<[[span class="bt"]]##b49f60|**Omar Amandi:**##[[/span]] pulls out a pen from his pocket, and shuffles with his sheaf of papers.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##b49f60|**Omar Amandi:**##[[/span]] Where were you during the failure of **PROJECT CYBERSPHERE**?

[[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8:**##[[/span]] In my office, doing paperwork and waiting for updates from Roseanne.

[[span class="bt"]]##b49f60|**Omar Amandi:**##[[/span]] Do you suspect Dir. Roseanne had anything to do with this?

//<[[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8:**##[[/span]] looks down on his desk>//

[[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8:**##[[/span]] Not really.

[[span class="bt"]]##b49f60|**Omar Amandi:**##[[/span]] Did you, and Dir. Roseanne ever performed previous tests and maintenance check-ups of AO-8747 to see if there were any deficiencies?

[[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8:**##[[/span]] No.

[[span class="bt"]]##b49f60|**Omar Amandi:**##[[/span]] Do you believe that lack of maintenance check was what led to [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]] being created in the first place?

[[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8:**##[[/span]] Yeah, but-

[[span class="bt"]]##b49f60|**Omar Amandi:**##[[/span]] So that's the issue, more evidence that you, the one who ordered AO-8747 to be constructed, are responsible for the creation of [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]] and -A; normally, these kinds of ambitious projects needs all of the Overseers to vote, but because it was an Apollyon-Class priority, you and the rest of the Council decided it was okay to only allow one. Not to mention, you are an Overseer responsible for overseeing Foundation projects, so to have someone like you take the role of that kind is questionable. 

[[span class="bt"]]##b49f60|**Omar Amandi:**##[[/span]] Speaking of which, we both know the remaining Overseers are going to vote on whether they should kick you out, or not for that matter. The only ones who can overrule that are the Ethics Committee, and Administrator, which is unlikely they'll side with you because most of the Ethics Committee are working hard to make sure you are punished for what happened and figuring out who could take your place. More than 300 sites can't even work properly because of what you've caused, and more than a thousand digital anomalies have experienced containment difficulties thanks to [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]], so from here on out, //you have to plead guilty to the Ethics Committee//.

//<[[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8:**##[[/span]] places both of his hands onto his face, as his elbows are placed onto the desk to provide support. He lifts off his right arm and points it towards Omar>.//

[[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8:**##[[/span]] You are very close to getting kicked out of //my// office, Amandi. Tell me you have at least something that I can work with, or leave before my guards do it for you.

[[span class="bt"]]##b49f60|**Omar Amandi:**##[[/span]] You could also go recommend a vote to go with Dir. Roseanne's idea to the Overseers, since you can overrule the O4's decision.

[[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8:**##[[/span]] Why should I do that? You know most of everyone's opinions are not on our side.

[[span class="bt"]]##b49f60|**Omar Amandi:**##[[/span]] Since when did an Overseer care about what people think of them?

[[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8:**##[[/span]] Omar...

[[span class="bt"]]##b49f60|**Omar Amandi:**##[[/span]] Okay, okay. Well, there isn't much of a choice for the Foundation to deal with containing [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]] itself, so the idea reprogramming AO-8747 to repair the Cybersphere isn't out of the question thanks to it's systems and hardware. Lots of engineers are constructing their own machines to deal with the anomaly, but why make a brand-new machine when we already have one?

//<[[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8**##[[/span]] lets out a chuckle.>//

[[span class="bt"]]##395e7f|**O5-8:**##[[/span]] That's the best idea I've ever heard from you, Omar; using AO-8747 that caused [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]], to fix [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]]. Love it.

[[span class="bt"]]##b49f60|**Omar Amandi:**##[[/span]] Joke about it all you want. It's not going to get you anywhere, just like your idea of lying to the Ethics Committee. As dumb as it sounds, it's still a possibility that it could work and when we're in a situation where were spending millions a day just to keep the public hush-hush about what's going on, we need to explore every idea we have.

[[span class="bt"]]##b49f60|**Omar Amandi:**##[[/span]] Remember, Roseanne's involved because you made her. If there's anyone at all who could show some sort of compassion- and who knows, get a //lesser sentence// thanks to said compassion- it's you.

= //[...]//
[[/<]]
[[/div]]
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[hcell]]
« END TRANSCRIPT »
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell]]
**AFTERWORD:** 10 minutes after the meeting concluded, Omar Amandi and O5-8 proceeded to the Ethics Committee Disciplinary room for review of events.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[hcell]]
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]
[[/table]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="overwatch_memo"]]
+ COUNCIL VOTE-8747-24
------
[[<]]
**PROPOSAL:** Based on evidence gathered, security footage, and testimonies of **PROJECT CYBERSPHERE** staff, it is the opinion of the O5 Council that O5-8 has majorly violated extensive Foundation policies, specifically those detailing Foundation project management and safety requirements, which led to the formation of an [[span class="bt"]]##DB5000|EKHI-##[[/span]]Class anomaly, resulting in the containment breach of over 1,000 digital anomalies and near collapse of the veil. As such, the O5 Council has deemed O5-8 to be unfit for an Overseer role and must be preemptively replaced. Below contains a summarized vote regarding O5-8's position.

**NOTE:** As the vote is directed towards a Foundation Overseer, O5-8's vote will not be considered.

[[=]]
**COUNCIL VOTE SUMMARY:**
||~ YAY ||~ NAY ||~ ABSTAIN ||
|| O5-1 || || ||
|| O5-2 || || ||
|| O5-3 || || || 
|| O5-4 || || ||
|| O5-5 || || ||
|| O5-6 || || ||
|| O5-7 || || ||
|| O5-9 || || || 
|| O5-10 || || ||
|| O5-11 || || ||
|| O5-12 || || ||
|| O5-13 || || ||
@@ @@
||~ STATUS||
||[[span class="bt"]]##ffc60b|APPROVED##[[/span]] ||
[[/=]]

**RESULTS:** Despite attempted negotiations, O5-8 failed to appeal his removal and demotion to the Ethics Committee. O5-8 will not be allowed to return to Overseer status, regardless of his contribution and improvement prior to D-Class demotion. During afterward discussions following the Council vote, O5-8 recommend the Foundation approve of Dir. Roseanne's proposal.
[[div class="blockquote"]]
[[/<]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[<]]

[[=]]

[[div class="darkdocument"]]
= [[span class="bt"]]##ff9e59|ADDENDUM 8747/3:##[[/span]] Final Report.
------
**INTENT:** Eradicate [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747-A##[[/span]]'s current nature, thereby neutralizing the anomaly, and anomalously repair its sector to pre-[[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747-A##[[/span]] status. This requires re-engineering of AO-8747's mechanics and functionality, whilst omitting usage of human sub-conscious transfer. 

**HYPOTHESIS:** By eradicating [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747-A##[[/span]], and repairing its sector within the Cybersphere, [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]]'s effects will be invalidated. Though while this is a hypothesis, the accurate outcome of [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747-A##[[/span]]'s eradication is uncertain; therefore, all IT, technical, and AIAD personnel must commence preparations for misplaced scenarios by this attempt.

**RESULTS:** Decommission attempt successful; Foundation computerized systems are now able to successfully overwrite undesired data prior to [[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]]'s effects. Furthermore, future Foundation projects involving manipulation of the Cybersphere has been indefinitely suspended, with the exception of unanimous approval by the O5 Council. 

[[span class="bt"]]##52a3cc|SCP-8747##[[/span]] is pending reclassification to NEUTRALIZED by the Classification Committee.
[[/div]]
